Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can illustrate a plant that is well-watered and in sunlight, showing it growing and thriving.
The student can illustrate a plant without water, demonstrating it as wilted or unhealthy.
The student can illustrate a plant in the dark, representing it as not growing or less healthy.
The student can include representations of the sun to show the presence of light for healthy plant growth.
The student can depict rain or a watering can to show the presence of water for healthy plant growth.
The student can demonstrate through patterns in the illustration how the lack of water or light impacts plant health.
CANNOT: (minor) The student might occasionally forget to label certain elements clearly, though the drawing still effectively communicates the intended ideas.
